definition: to feast one's eyes
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to eat till full/satisfied
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: Yet its large TFT display is a feast for the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它的大TFT显示屏真是让人大饱眼福。

sentences.english: The tour of Guilin glutted my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 桂林一游使我大饱眼福。

sentences.english: Well, let's move on to today's Feast for the Eyes.
sentences.chinese: 好了，一起来进入我们今天的赏心悦目大饱眼福吧。

sentences.english: The authors' narration to various sports activities will surely make readers feast their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 作者对各种体育运动的叙述定会令读者大饱眼福。

sentences.english: The audience feasted their eyes on the wonderful performance.
sentences.chinese: 精彩演出让观众大饱眼福。

sentences.english: As of Saturday, all you need is an Internet connection.
sentences.chinese: 如果是周六，你只需上网就可大饱眼福。

sentences.english: Jordan gave the audience a treat with a flurry of high-flying dunks.
sentences.chinese: 乔丹一连串的高空扣篮令观众大饱眼福。

definition: to feast one's eyes on (idiom)
to feast one's eyes on (idiom)
a treat for the eyes/the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to be full of praise (idiom)
warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
visually attractive/eye candy/easy on the eyes/to protect the eyes
to exclaim in astonishment
lit. blood vessels swell wide (idiom)/fig. one's blood runs quicker/to be excited
